Reviews.Title: “not good”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Worst place I have ever stayed, rooms are not that good. A lot of noise from travelers. People smoking weed and fags even tho its a no smoking building. Reception is down the street

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about this one!”
Reviews.Author: BellaroseAnnecy
Reviews.Content: Worst hotel we ever had the opportunity to stay in. Besides the very smelly socks we found in the drawer next to our bed, the drains of this hotel stank like nothing else in this world. We dreaded to head back at the end of the night and after complaining about the filthy room we were put in, was told that: "the cleaning was done by an independent company, all the rooms were the same, and because the hotel was always fully booked, no room was ever cleaned properly." If you are thinking of going to Amsterdam don't waist your money or time on this one!!! It is not cheap for what you get and not possible to cancel when booked in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful”
Reviews.Author: lou6062
Reviews.Content: Please do not ignore all the bad reviews they are all true ! This has to be one of the worst hotels ever, It is dirty and smelly. The staff are indifferent. The rooms are minute. Curtains do not hang prpoerly . Shower would be good if it drained well and the sealant around the bottom was not black with mould. I think even homeless people would be loathe to stay at here. I would advise any hotel booking site to remove it from their listing and the Amsterdam tourist board should close it down

Reviews.Title: “Do not bother”
Reviews.Author: Wendylou60
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with some trepidation as we had read previous negative reviews. I did e-mail previously to ask the hotel management how they responded to negative reviews and had they addressed areas of concern - I should have known by the reply which was very bland that they didn't do anything . The place was dirty and dingy , the bathroom smelt , the shower sealant was thick with mould , the carpet and curtains were filthy - I have to say the towels were good and the water pressure in the shower was good (however didn't drain well)but they are the only good things that I can say . We had to change rooms as the first was so small - nowhere even to hang clothes (probably best left in the case anyway) and the second was not much better although at least we could open a window to let clean air into the room. The staff were disinterested is all I can say about them

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting - Don't go!”
Reviews.Author: little_mis_star
Reviews.Content: As a group of friends we stayed at Hotel Paganini under the premise that we were getting a hotel. How wrong were we! The price is extortionate for the quality of the rooms. We were placed in a room on the fifth floor that had 6 beds crammed in with numbers above each bed like some of camp. The location is okay, but other than that I agree with the other reviews. I wish I had been on tripadvisor before booking our stay. What a horrible, grotty, dirty place. Avoid! Even when we complained due to false advertising they had nothing to say to offer any consolation. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “over priced”
Reviews.Author: DRTraveller81
Reviews.Content: Great location and access to the city !!!!! but the room was not clean, and the bed was uncomfortable. The place felt like a youth hostel quality or even more poor than that, so definitely was overpriced for what you got. We asked for a room with a window and were put on the street level with windows we could not open otherwise the passersby would be able to reach in a take our things or touch us - so, we had to lock the windows at all times and keep the curtains closed. that was very unpleasant. The breakfast was good value for the cost. Daytime desk staff (in another building) were good, but evening staff were inattentive and gave bad information and service. The experience was ok until the last day. We slept through our alarm clock and at 11:00AM sharp (check out time) the cleaning staff knocked on our door and asked us to vacate the room immediately. I had just woken up and explained that we had slept through our alarm and need to get cleaned up and pack our suitcases. The staff person replied that we needed to vacate the room immediately and that it was not his problem that we had slept through the alarm clock. we were given 5 minutes to pack and leave. That was RUDE and totally unecessary !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague”
Reviews.Author: Genghis_11
Reviews.Content: I'm not a man of high expectations and often laugh at some peoples reviews of half decent hotels but this place really is tremendously bad. It wasn't that cheap either. The double room was the size of a shoe box and had 2 very small beds and nothing else, to give you an idea of how small it was we had to lift our suitcase on to the bed to get the door open. It was also filthy and needed a gutting to be honest, the window which overlooks a busy street didn't shut properly so it was noisy too. In short you would have a much more pleasant stay in this wonderful city if on arrival you punched the first policeman you saw and stayed in the cells. That's rubbish for site seeing though.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly disgusting, never ever stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Courts_11
Reviews.Content: Utterly awful hotel. Too far out of the city for what it was offering. Total bill for 3 nights was 387 euros. The room was the size of a broom cupboard. Overlooking a stair well. Nowehere to hang clothes. Cracked glass on painting on the wall. The room was obscenely priced for what it was meant to be. The hotel would not refund us our money despite note even wanting to stay there. There was nobody in charge, they refused to let me speak to a manager. The receptionist took no responsibility despite being the only person to be in charge and did not speak good english. Save yourself the upset, and go elsewhere. Utter con-merchants.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting, awful, thieves, no health and safety. Cheats”
Reviews.Author: raducci
Reviews.Content: I went to amsterdam and i was under the impression that i will stay in a decent hotel. as I arrive to the outside of the building, a note said: go to building 97/or else, where the reception was. So no reception where I was staying i had to go to an other building. at night i realised the sheets had blood on them and actually were not changed so I had to leave the building and walk to the other building to ask for new sheets.... Unfortunately they did not have any left (quilt covers). so we had no covers and it was very cold as it rained the day after. The heating was broken. When we asked to see the manager the receptionist said that we had to come back at 4 pm as he was at hospital in the morning...in the afternoon someone else said he was on vacation in paris! why the lies. tHIS HOTEL IS A DIRTY HOSTEL AND NOT A HOTEL. THEY NEED TO BE TAKEN OFF

Reviews.Title: “Could and should do better in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Skiwithjill
Reviews.Content: I'm going to echo pretty much all of the reviews on here regarding the Paganini Hotel... you could do a lot better to stay somewhere else. It was indeed VERY dirty; the carpet in the reception looked as though it hadn't been vaccumed in years and most surfaces in our room hadn't been wiped down in about as long. The room was dingy and the bed uncomfortable; the one we were in was right next to the breakfast room and the walls were so thin we could hear people eating before we left in the morning. No bed bugs, but that felt like a miracle! One good-ish thing that could be said about it is location; it's across from a pretty tree-lined canal, but of course that doesn't make up for the other things it lacks. We would NOT come back, and I shudder to think what friends would think of us if we ever recommneded it...

Reviews.Title: “sleazy, sleazy”
Reviews.Author: sleven56
Reviews.Content: two nights of madness in one of the most sleaziest hotels i ever slept in. the rooms are very small. our first room had two singel beds and was located on the main street side. it was very loud and one couldn't close the window. the next nght we slept in another room with a double bed to avoid the noise on the street and there wasn't any ventilation. the air was very bad, the lights did't work and just as noisy not from the street but from the other guest. we decided not to stay the third night and promptly requested our money back for the third night and of course we were refused. we were told that in order to get our money back we had to cancell our reservation seven days in advance. we were also told that we shouldn't have paid for the three nights instead we should have paid on a daily basis. howvever the receptionist told us that we had to pay for the three nights in advance. this hotel should be called a shitel. this is the worse place i've ever slept in amsterdam. ps until now no bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the web site photos, reality is very different.”
Reviews.Author: shakirajames
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel online with Easybook.com based on photos and desc. on official web site. I wished I'd read reviews first. The entrance is dirty and looks like the very cheapest of hostels, which it isn't! We tried to cancel but were told that we had to give 7 days notice and as they have your card details they have you !!!!!!!! We asked to see the room before we booked in officially and when we went up and opened the door there was still someone in bed. We gave them 2 hours to clean the room and then returned. To be absolutely fair the sheets and towels were clean but you could hardly get in the room it was so small and it constantly smelt of sewage. There was a small wardrobe which had a big hole in it but you couldn't use it because there wasn't room to open the door. This so called hotel should be removed from any self respecting hotel booking web site. DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Alphen aan den Rijn, The Netherlands
Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel, rubbish breakfast and got bitten by bedbugs!”
Reviews.Author: mishimoto1976
Reviews.Content: The hotel check in desk is not in the actual place you stay in the hotel, its located 6 doors down the road. Also for breakfast we had to walk 6 doors down to other hotel to have breakfast. Got bitten by bed bugs from the dirty bed. Mattress was so old and soft that you were almost rolling off the side of the bed in the night. Breakfast rubbish. Only good thing to say about the hotel, was the shower was good!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel Ive ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: girl_e
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel Vivaldi but were given a room in the basement with a pavement level window that was all dusty and noisy so changed rooms to sister hotel a few doors down. Room was tiny, barely any room around the (rather uncomfortble) double bed. Bedding and bathroom were nice and clean but everything else could have done with a good going over. We decided to just not look too closely at the dirty bits! Our room had no outside window, just one opening onto the stairwell. One morning the downstairs hallway was scattered with rat/mouse droppings which stayed there all day! For breakfast we had to go back to the other hotel. The breakfast room was small and very tatty with broken windows looking onto a garden with overflowing bins. Breakfast was cheap processed ham and cheese, budget sliced bread and cereal, and not much else! But the coffee from the machine (which was only free at breakfast) was decent enough. Some of the staff were ok but others were grumpy. When we handed our key in at the end of our stay they just grunted and didnt even say thankyou let alone if we'd had a good stay!! On a positive note, it was reasonably located, about a 20 min walk into the centre, and did have a really good shower!!

Reviews.Title: “Hell hole..pls take these reviews seriously!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wema34
Reviews.Content: Should have read the reviews before booking this hell hole.... Entrance is a door that needs cleaning....steep stairway to our room or a lift that can only take two people. There's only enough space for small twin beds and a TV hung dangerously on the wall. Our room faced the road and window opened out onto the street separated by a mesh....outside was a spot for dumping trash..too noisy. Bathroom was okay but toilet space was so small your face was in the sink... Breakfast was a disaster, not enough sitting space for guests and tea/coffee served from a dispenser....not enough cutlery...Staff not helpful. My worst hotel experience....gave me such a negative view of amsterdam till we checked out into a nicer hotel in The Hague

Reviews.Title: “very basic, with central location”
Reviews.Author: Pilts
Reviews.Content: If u r not looking for anything fancy but just a place to crash then this is for you. The hotel Paganini and Vivaldi are right next to each other and the check in is done at Vivaldi (which was not inconvenient). I stayed in triple room which had a bunk bed + single bed. I must say the bunk bed was alright, not too hard, not too soft. The room is very small though, we had only hand luggages and I can't imagine being there with 3 huge luggages! Other than that it was an OK place to stay, considering it was the cheapest available at the time of booking ( 99â‚¬/ triple room w breakfast). It was good that the windows faced a back garden, so it was very quiet during night-time. The best thing about it was the location: right next to Heineken brewery, close to tram station, Vondelpark, and ofcourse the city centre (10-15 min walk). Breakfast is very simple, just a few sandwich materials, coffee, tea, juice.

Reviews.Title: “3 blind mice in the ho(s)tel”
Reviews.Author: Travell3rrrr
Reviews.Content: Whilst writing this i can actually hear the mice scratching on the floorboard in our tiny room. This isn't a hotel it is a hostel that is mice infested. Checking out tomorrow and moving to a real decent hotel with proper beds and not bunk beds. The space between our beds are smaller than an airplane's aisle!! We have photos of the mouse peeking through the hole.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing dump !”
Reviews.Author: Petru55
Reviews.Content: Dont't go to that "hotel". It is dirty, ugly and unfrinedly. The towels and the bed sheets were used, broken and dirty. The breakfast is coffe from the machine / bread / 1 ham / 1 cheese / 1 chocolate.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: jfruiz
Reviews.Content: No words to say how this Hotel is dirty....absolutely not recomended

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing isn't the right word...”
Reviews.Author: CaroleIreland
Reviews.Content: Ok, on arrival, we discovered the hotel reception and all other "facilities" are 8 buildings down from where we were to stay. The staff were unfriendly and unwelcoming but we carried on to our building. Upon entering the building we were overwhelmed with the stench of dead mouse and rubbish spilling out of the bin at the door. The room was tiny and the toilet didn't flush and a wardrobe door was hanging off..we had to prop a chair up against it to keep it closed because the lack of space meant we couldn't get passed it. The bed seemed clean and comfortable enough but the slip came off my pillow and i realised I was sleeping on a drool stained yellow pillow. On the last day I discovered a bag of rotting oranges under the bed...so obviously the rooms aren't cleaned properly. Breakfast was another battle...even off season there is not enough room for the guests to sit down and eat and some were left standing. The dishes ran out quickly and my daughter was met with a grumpy unhelpful staff member who really resented having to wash a cup for her to get a drink. That particular staff member was ignorant and barged his way though us to get on with his chores. There was no toaster which to me is a most basic breakfast requirement. We ended up eating breakfast elsewhere. The only good thing about the hotel was the view of the canal..fortunately we didn't the get the "garden" view which was a dump with rubbish and fag ends all over the place. Only one staff member was somewhat helpful when we wanted to print out our boarding passes for our flight that day. Thankfully, the rest of our Amsterdam trip was wonderful..we will be back but will most definitly not stay in this "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Thecurioustraveller3
Reviews.Content: Bedroom too small for two people, fixtures and fittings damaged, carpet and wall stained and dirty. Bathroom clean, but smelled very badly of sewerage. Overpriced hotel bearing in mind condition and no facilities. Staff not welcoming. Pressurised to pay for stay before even seeing room! We stayed one night only and RAN AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Laudia1
Reviews.Content: Very small room (no space for a cabinett) with old furniture, the bed was so soft and uncomfortable, very dirty (hair in bed and shower when we arrived), no fresh towels, no cleaning at all (we stayed 3 nights), and the 'cleaner' STOLE A RING. and all I got was a complaint form because they couldnÂ´t reach the manager...ha ha ha And 1 night for the double room was 80 â‚¬!!!

Reviews.Title: “Complete Dump, Very Dirty, Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Stevens281
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in Jan 09, and I still ask myself why I didnt go elsewhere after night 1. I read the reviews, and they were like mine, all negitive, but tried it anyway. To start off the road was under construction, not the hotels fault, but made it harder to find. There is no sign out in front of the hotel, find it by #. To check in you have to go back 50 yards to the other hotel. My room was on the first floor, and complete [-] Hole, nasty carpet and bed, dirty bathroom, small room, and right next to the front doo. Was so dan noisy, even earplugs didnt help. I was changed to the 4th floor the next day. Room was a little better as far as being clean, but not great. Still very noisy. Walls are paper thin, can hear talking, laughing, sex, not very appealing. The breakfast was nasty. The staff was pleasant and helpful, I will say that. Was in a ok location. I would def NOT stay here again. Not even in my college days would I have wanted to stay here. Trust me, dont go here.

Reviews.Title: “HEINOUS”
Reviews.Author: JacanDawta
Reviews.Content: The only thing that was good about this hotel was that the room was ready when I got there in the morning - it was ALL downhill from there! To check in you had to walk half a block to Hotel Vivaldi tas there is no reception at the Hotel Paganini. Then you had to carry your bags yourself to Hotel Paganini and up a Third Floor Walkup, to a room that STANK of weed (there was a no smoking sign but ?). Also, the room itself is nothing at all like the website, it can barely hold a Full size bed and your suitcase, oh yes there is a night table too with the DUSTIEST telephone you could imagine, they could have made the bathroom smaller and given me a bigger room...seriously! The complimentary breakfast was half a block away at the Hotel Vivaldi - again..... and it was nasty, only did that one morning. After that I paid for my breakfast down the street. Also, the staff are not very helpful, they all behave very vague as if you are asking for something so far out of their realm of ability. Oh, also had to use my curling iron and stretch on tiptoes to turn on the overhead tv as the remote did not work. Please do not go there, they are not worth even 1 euro per night!

Reviews.Title: “classified as a hotel HA! HA!”
Reviews.Author: blueboytwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel that we booked into was the hotel paganini in amsterdam ten minute fom the railway station opposite the brewery. From which the hotel inspectors must have come from before looking at it. On arrival there is a note on the door that you have to go to the sister hotel which is futher down the road this hotel is the vivaldi. You are informed that there is no reception at the paganini and breakfast is from the hotel vivaldi. So you have to walk from one hotel to the other. The breakfast room has about ten two people tables in it. The vivaldi has three floors two with six bedrooms and top with five. this give a minium of 17 beds and 17 couples or 34 people the other hotel is of simular size with a possible extra three beds because it does not have a reception so it is crazy at breakfast. I requested an extra pillow and was to they didnot have any more. The evening staff could not care if they do anything for you The three days that we were there the beds were not made once If it was not for the wondreful time that we had in the city and spent as little time in the hotel the week end would have been a total waste of money> if any one would like to see the size of the bedroom i can email them with a photo the room, it was so small that we could not get any of our clothes out of the suite case because there was no wardrobe in the room This has to be the worst hotel i have stayed in. I will be writing to the owner for my money back it was so bad.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: Below in point form. Positives * good range of television channels. * friendly staff * nice part of town, away from the hustle and bustle / over ridden with tourist areas. close to museums, paradiso, etc. * everything functional * on tram line, 10-15 minutes to Amsterdam Centraal. Negatives * Tiny room. * No lift / very steep stairs * To my knowledge, no "hotel" facilities such as sauna, spa, breakfast (if there was, I was not informed at any stage), mini bar, table. miscellaneous notes * my window opened, unlike some other people's stories Overall, I found this place to be clean and tidy, but not worth what I paid for it. I realise Amsterdam is an expensive city, but I got a similar last minute deal in Rotterdam for a much nicer hotel for a fair bit cheaper. Staff were friendly and accommodating. However, the room was very tiny, and lacking in many features.

Reviews.Title: “0 Stars”
Reviews.Author: cadiwales
Reviews.Content: Booked into the Hotel on the 22nd, hallway carpet dirty, bag of cement by the bedroom door, bed filled the room, no wardrobe, no drawers to keep our clothes, smell of urine, no ventilation. Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in. Left after one night, never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Bad”
Reviews.Author: rlg421
Reviews.Content: A total misrepresentation of a 3 star hotel. A homeless shelter would have more stars -- no dresser, no nightstand, no space between beds, missing remote, phone was on the floor because there was no place to set it - a pretty shabby place all in all. I am shocked that it would be classified as three stars - one star would be overrating this place. Had we not been concerned that we wouldn't be able to find another hotel during the height of the tourist season -- we would have walked out five seconds after walking in. First of all, the hotel wasn't even open and there was a sign on the door to go down the street to another hotel (owned by the same people). The front desk employee was not helpful and almost rude when we asked questions. The breakfast room was crowded and very uncomfortable to sit in -- I HIGHLY RECOMMEND AGAINST THIS PLACE....

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Joyce12
Reviews.Content: How this hotel has any stars I fail to understand. How it can even be classed as a hotel is a joke. On entering the place it is filthy and cluttered. There was a sewerage smell in the stair up to our room. The carpet in the room was filthy, taps loose in the basin. Your wardrobe was 3 hooks with 3 hangers. Basically it was disgusting and so bad that we couldn't even stay there for 1 night. I would not recommend this place to anyone - wouldn't even keep an animal there.

Reviews.Title: “Awfull”
Reviews.Author: Cretu
Reviews.Content: As someone wrote in their Guest Book .. .a very nice place to break! We asked for a smoking double room, they confirmed and we have found nothing but one small room with no windows to be open, no ashtray and above all , the fire alarm on... so please smoke , the fire dept will come! Next day we asked them to change the room for what we have paid (3 star rate for no star services). After wondering with our luggages up and down the stairs, the receptionist said: I'll show you another one, the last and hope you will be satisfied cause you drive me crazy" ... a very professional atitude! Don't go there not even if it is for free!

Reviews.Title: “Smallest double room in a 3 star hotel?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our double room contained one double bed and one bedside cupboard (one small drawer and two tiny shelves). TV on the wall. Nothing else. Hanging space was two coathangers on a hook. This was an internal room with no window. A small amount of natural light came down the stairwell and into the room via a glass panel from the room onto the stairs. But you needed to keep the curtains closed so in effect it was dark all the time. It was very warm and 'air con' was provided by a small cool air fan unit, on all the time. The 24 hour reception was good and made it feel secure. Staff were friendly. Breakfast was adequate though we chose to eat elsewhere after the first morning. The situation was great - museums, trams round the corner, reasonably priced places to eat locally, Albert Cuyp market, and everything else either a walk or tram ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Buczy
Reviews.Content: We spent in the hotel 5 nights.In general we were satisfied with the hotel: good location (abt. 25-30 minutes from the centre on foot, or 10-15 minutes by tram, the tram station is very near to the hotel), friendy staff, delicious buffet breakfast, room cleaning and towel change every day. The bathroom is clean, spacious, confortable. The window is big with a nice view to the street and to the channel. Disadvantages: there is no cupboard for the clothes, only 4 hangers on the wall. There are neither hangers for the towels. The bed is not really good because there is a separate mattress on its top which often slides down. The room was a little noisy. All in all it is a good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Paganini ss not located centrally as stated, it is at least 45 minute walk to the centrum and nothing to do in the immediate area. The double room was minute ... comprised of a double bed, two bedside dressers (one drawered) with lamps on, no storage facilities for clothing or ANYTHING, Could hardly move around the room and I am tiny! Bathroom: shower flooded in bathroom at each use and we notified the staff on the first day and no action was taken to rectify the problem, meaning we used our supply of two small towels to soak up the water on the floor. Towels and bedding were not changed once in 4 days, nor was the room cleaned or aired by staff. The noise from the rooms adjoining and above travelled easily to our room. The description of Hotel Paganini that we booked on the basis of was extremely misleading and actually sounded rather nice, we would NOT have booked had we known the true quality of the hotel and nor will we stay there again. The two members of staff that we did see when we came in or out of the building were pleasant enough.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel certainly is not the best in Amsterdam, for 55 Euro a night/single it is a good value for money. Room was small but clean, and the private facilities were better than at most budget hotels. It is very easy to reach the hotel by taking the tram from the train station. It you want to save some money for Amsterdam's night life, this hotel is good option.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: wawawa
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room for two nights and was given a room with two twin beds pushed together. There was no space for anything else in the room apart from a small bedside table, a mirror, and a TV which was above the door. No chair, no cupboards. There were three coathangers on the wall. The bathroom was fine and the shower excellent, but there were no pegs for the towels. These were laid out on the bed. When I said I did not like the room and would not be staying for a second night the receptionist was polite but totally unconcerned.

HotelInfo.Name: Paganini Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Stadhouderskade 68, Amsterdam 1072 AD, The Netherlands
